I went shopping today and got the spraypaint that I needed. I prepped one of the green Hulk hands, giving it a light sanding, washed it with soap and water and then sprayed it with the Duplicolor vinyl and fabric spray. The coat looks good so far, albeit it's a little shiny despite being marked as matte. That's okay since I'm going to hit it with primer once it's dry anyway.

I also painted some of the other primed parts with the dark brown spray paint. It looks like a really good color and should give Kong's fur some variety. Once they're touch-dry I'll take some pictures. I'm really excitied because I should have him all put back together sometime in the next few days, and it'll be my first time seeing him without any hint of the original Hulk colors.

last_replies.com:
>>10142829
If they would just take The Mass Device, make it a half hour longer and give it more adult sounding dialogue, and shoot it in live action, you'd have a $500 million-$1 billion blocbuster. The story is not any dumber than a Marvel movie, it just has dialogue that sounds like a kid's show. It's got big high-concept, high stakes action sequences, believable peril for the heroes, and a cast of memorable characters that it manages to bounce around between without anyone feeling lost.

In short, it holds up surprisingly well and proves to me that GI Joe could be a great movie franchise if they don't fuck it up and try to hide what it is that people love about it. Sure, you could argue it's military propaganda, but with how much everyone in the USA hates each other right now is it really such a bad thing to have a story about very different people who all work together because they love their country? Isn't that what GI Joe was really saying for being ahead of its time in terms of featuring racial and ethnic diversity, while still championing the ideas of patriotism and love for your fellow countrymen?

>>10141331
Yes, but it wasnt needed, you really dont need to put down a coat for slides, then another coat. You just finish the build with a coat. But yea it will still work, have a wet q-tip handy if a piece dosnt wanna move, slap the q-tip on it and it will become loose. Just throwing out there how I do slides- cut out n soak for about a minute, fish it out with beauty tweezers, the kind where one side angles to a point, lay the slide where you want and use a dull toothpick to slide off the decal and re-arange it, but a q-tip works also- roll out the water with a dry q-tip, apply a lil mark set, wait a day and topcoat. Sorry about my tangent, just want to help those interested in watersides. Mr mark softer is rarely needed, it mainly slightly melts the decal to bend around shapes or separated pieces, and the need for that hardly comes up. Ok il shut the hell up now, hopefully someone got something from that

A lot of people all-in and I just don't see how they have the space for it. I do get what you mean though in terms of how long it takes waves to come out and all that, I understand it's just one guy and some chinese factory workers basically rather than a proper toy company, but it's taken 6-7 years since the line was announced before you could make an obligatory "T.Rex vs. Triceratops" sort of display.
I understand the whole "re-use molds for other figures" thing, it makes sense, and I'm sure theres budget reasons per-line, but it's still annoying. In the end though I buy these at retail, I don't mess with the kickstarter, and I only buy what I want, so far my only issue I've had (and I consider it major), is that the plastic on the upper inner thigh of my adult Trike had a tear in it out of the box, and I have no idea how I'll repair that if it ever gets worse.

threads.com:
It's November 1st, so you know what that means. It's time for /toy/ Secret Santa 2022!

There doesn't appear to be as many shipping delays this year but I'm still making the cut off for sign up November 6th like last year because it worked out well and gives everyone through the weekend to sign up. I will try to have assignments out by the 7th or the 8th at the latest.

There are some small changes to SS this year though:
>The budget has been changed from 25-35 usd to 30-40 usd
>Proof of purchase will now require you to send me a picture of your gift with a timestamp before I give it the ok along with the receipt
>I will not be pairing up Canadians domestically due to issues in the past. Those who wish to ship domestic will be paired with people in the US. Sorry for the inconvenience.

For more info on these changes check the FAQ as I've detailed it there for the exception of the price change because the explanation for that is very simple. I picked out the original 25-35 price range several years ago and after years of running the event I felt bumping the price up by 5 dollars better reflects what people actually spend on the event, that's all.

My email: toysecretsanta2022@gmail.com

How do you guys feel about damaging/destroying your soldiers? Blowing up army men with firecrackers has certainly been a longstanding cliché but I never did that myself, even when I had the means. A broken soldier was always a great tragedy, I hated to throw one out and would do my best to repair them when possible. Several of the solders in pic have been repaired/modded with parts cannibalized from an army that was such poor quality I didn't have any qualms about cutting them up for bits; beyond that I don't have it in me to deliberately break or mutilate a plastic soldier.

I quite enjoy the Plastic Apocalypse series of videos and there's no shortage of ruined army men there, could never do that myself though.

threads.com: Anyone know any worm or tentacle monster toys? Preferably ones that can eat other figures.

last_replies.name: Anonymous

>>10137346
>mfw finally help a fellow /toy/anon
Feels good man

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10133806
Hasbro Rathtar came in and I finally had a chance for some quick testing today.

You have to put on the tentacles yourself. They are hard PVC-like plastic with some flexibility to them. As I expected soaking them in hot water makes them completely bendable and they will hold their shape once cooled down (pic related, before and after wrapping around the included figure). As they remain slightly flexible overbending is recommended to get tight grabs. The tentacles have different lengths, which straightened out they vary from 10 to 15cm. 2 of the tentacles have "grabber" tips, the others classic rounded tips.

The pegs and pegholes used for the tentacles are all the same shape and size so you can freely mix and match positions as you please, even if the instructions specify a specific order. However the tentacles are prone to falling off when inserted cold. Instead you want to heat up the pegs which gives them way a better fit. The instructions don't mention this which explains all the complaints from angry parents. As for movement, it only allows for rotation.

The mouth and teeth are soft PVC. The mouth's opening is 27mm wide and 22mm tall. The body is hard plastic and hollow. Measured from the mouth it goes 86mm deep. The sculpt has a lot of details which would benefit from a wash.

At €15 (€10 post gift card) I'd say it makes for a nice affordable option for degenerate uses. It might be annoying to pose and a bit small for larger figures, but definitely useable. Now to decide what figure I want to pose with it...

>Amiami - usual place for buying, to some people, shipping is a bit higher due to packaging

>Mandarake - search figma or フィグマ
>eBay/Amazon - only if you hate having too much money. Avoid bootlegs, you can spot them as 'Chinese version'
